titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bidoun Projects Archive MSS.399
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Larkin, 2018.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-12 21:18:43 -0500.

physdesc.extent: in 1 half manuscript box, 1 flat box, and 1 flat file folder.

did.abstract: Bidoun is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting and promoting arts and culture from the Middle East. Bidoun Projects, the curatorial branch of the Bidoun organization, commissions and manages artists' projects, exhibitions, and events. The Bidoun Projects Archive contains promotional material, printed ephemera, and publications created by Bidoun Projects. Materials date from 2009 to 2012.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Bidoun Projects, 2013. The accession number associated with this gift is 2014.399.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Bidoun is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting and promoting arts and culture from the Middle East. Bidoun was founded as a print publication in 2004 by Lisa Farjam, eventually expanding to curatorial projects. Bidoun Projects, the curatorial branch of the Bidoun organization, commissions and manages artists' projects, exhibitions, and events.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Bidoun Projects Archive; MSS 399; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Bidoun Projects Archive contains a small amount of printed ephemera related to events hosted by Bidoun Projects, including fliers, invitations, programs, and posters. The collection also contains a tote bag, t-shirts, and a few Bidoun publications, including magazines, auction catalogs, and a library catalog. Materials date from 2009 to 2012.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Bidoun Projects was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
